column4: I am running Fedora Core 6 with KDE 3.5.6, and kernel 2.6.19-1.2911.fc6. Whenever I run a 3D app, for example glxgears, the process pegs the cpu at 100% as shown by top. This occurs even if I login to a failsafe terminal. I am using a gefore fx 5700 with the latest nvidia drivers. This problem occurs with all recent nvidia drivers. I have tried both the livna drivers and the *sh files from nvidia.com. B

eryl and other 3D apps are pretty unusable because of this. For more information, please visit http://redqueen.serveftp.com/pub/problem/ where you will find relevant configuration files, lsmod, lspci etc. I have been trying unsucessfully to resolve this problem via google and IRC. The beryl devs narrowed it down to being all 3D apps, including glxgears. Does anyone else have this issue, or any ideas of
what could cause it? Thanks. I've also noticed that this problem is mentioned on the ubuntu forums but never solved.
